snippet: Apple Inc issued a patch on Thursday to fix a dangerous security flaw in iPhones and iPads after researchers discovered that a prominent United Arab Emirates dissident's phone had been targeted with a previously unknown method of hacking.

headline.main: Apple Fixes Security Flaw After UAE Dissident's iPhone Targeted
headline.print_headline: Apple Fixes Security Flaw After UAE Dissident's iPhone Targeted

snippet: Big data centers for the likes of Apple, Facebook and Google are increasing the demand for renewable energy, which may spur the construction of green facilities.

headline.main: Daily Report: More Clean Energy, Brought to You by the Cloud

snippet: Elton John, Britney Spears, Alicia Keys and Calvin Harris are among the performers at this year's Apple Music Festival.

headline.main: Elton John, Britney Spears Join Apple Music Festival Lineup
headline.print_headline: Elton John, Britney Spears Join Apple Music Festival Lineup

snippet: A U.S. senator seen by Silicon Valley as one of the technology industry's main foes in Congress is fighting for his political life as Donald Trump's slumping poll numbers threaten to damage Republican candidates across the board.

headline.main: Tech Firms' Encryption Foe Struggles for U.S. Senate Re-election
headline.print_headline: Tech Firms' Encryption Foe Struggles for U.S. Senate Re-election

snippet: The European Commission rebuffed an attack by the U.S. Treasury on its investigations into alleged sweetheart tax deals between companies such as Apple and McDonald's and European governments, saying there was no anti-U.S. bias.

headline.main: Brussels Rebuffs U.S. Attack on EU Tax Investigations
headline.print_headline: Brussels Rebuffs U.S. Attack on EU Tax Investigations

snippet: The European Union's campaign to crack down on tax avoidance by multinationals has drawn unusually public criticism from the U.S., which says it is unfairly targeting American companies.

headline.main: Why the EU's Tax Probe of Multinationals Is Raising US Ire
headline.print_headline: Why the EU's Tax Probe of Multinationals Is Raising US Ire

snippet: The Federal Reserve meets with protesters, anger over drug pricing continues to boil and the Treasury Department takes the European Commission to task over tax.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Fed Protesters, the Mylan Furor, Trans-Atlantic Tax Tussles

snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Friday:

Hillary Clinton mingled with Hall of Fame basketball player Magic Johnson and Apple CEO Tim Cook, vamped in a photo booth with actor Justin Timberlake and dined with some of California's richest families on what was likely the most lucrative fundr...

headline.main: Clinton's Gold Rush: $18 Million Raised on Three-Day Swing

snippet: The suspicious text message that appeared on Ahmed Mansoor's iPhone promised to reveal details about torture in the United Arab Emirates' prisons. All Mansoor had to do was click the link.

headline.main: Activist Discovers iPhone Spyware, Sparking Security Update
headline.print_headline: Activist Discovers iPhone Spyware, Sparking Security Update
